input_text:
Job Title: Project Administrator

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
SummaryThis position is an opportunity for a motivated and highly skilled administrative professional who wishes to be part of our expanding team. The Project Administrator will play a key role in providing support to our engineering, operations/project management, and design teams to successfully deliver numerous fire protection projects. The successful candidate must be self-motivated, detail-oriented, organized, dependable, helpful, flexible, and willing to perform a variety of tasks with little guidance.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Provide support on multiple projects throughout the lifecycle from inception to completion by setting up projects in the project database, assigning tasks, taking notes, and setting up for invoicing. Assist with project budget tracking, change order management, quality compliance, and keeping project management reporting software/tools updated.Attend customer and internal calls as required.Coordinate effective meetings by preparing information needed, listening, and taking meeting notes.Provide excellent internal and external customer service support.Understand and provide customer billing requirements to Finance.Work within tight task/project timeframes on multiple projects.Take comprehensive notes in the project database and communicate any issues, action items, and invoicing needs to project management. Perform miscellaneous tasks assigned by senior personnel for finance, operations, business development and/or marketing.Â· Completion of tasks and projects based on final customer schedule.
Education and/or Experience Requirements:High School diploma required3+ years administrative assistant or project administrator experience, preferably in the construction or fire protection industry.High proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Teams, OneNote) and Share Point.Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies including project management databases.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Demonstrates high level thinking and problem-solving skills.Excels at building and maintaining professional working relationships.Ability to work remotely and independently.Must be self-motivated.
Physical RequirementsConstantly work effectively using a personal computer for long periods of time. Frequently required to use hands/fingers to handle or feel objects, tools, and controls.Constantly be able to focus vision on objects at a close range.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Project Administrator
output_json.summary: An opportunity for a motivated and skilled administrative professional to support engineering, operations, and design teams.
tools_and_technologies: MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Teams, OneNote)
job_responsibilities: Support multiple projects throughout their lifecycle
Set up projects in the project database
Communicate issues, action items, and invoicing needs
output_json.physical_requirements: Constantly work effectively using a personal computer for long periods of time. Frequently required to use hands/fingers to handle or feel objects, tools, and controls. Constantly be able to focus vision on objects at a close range.

other.content:
High School diploma required
3+ years administrative assistant or project administrator experience, preferably in the construction or fire protection industry.
High proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Teams, OneNote) and Share Point.
Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies including project management databases.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Demonstrates high level thinking and problem-solving skills.
Excels at building and maintaining professional working relationships.
Ability to work remotely and independently.
Must be self-motivated.
